title: rqog-package for R

what: Download data and plot numeric indicators
title: rqog-package for R
text: Basic Data Basic data selection common indicators, 344 indicators 211 countries. example extract data population Democracy (Freedom House/Polity) index BRIC-countries 1990 2010 plot .  Standard data Standard data includes 2190 indicators 211 countries. example extract data Economic Performance GINI index (World Bank estimate) BRIC-countries plot .  OECD data OECD data includes 1006 variables, smaller number wealthier countries 36. example four indicators: Total expenditure health oecd_pphlthxp_t1c Income inequality: GINI index (World Bank estimate) wdi_gini Gross National Income per Capita oecd_natinccap_t1 Adjusted general government debt--GDP (excl. unfunded pension liability) oecd_govdebt_t1 include countries years included data.
code: library(rqog) library(dplyr) library(ggplot2) library(tidyr) # Download a local coppy of the file basic <- read_qog(which_data="basic", data_type = "time-series") # Subset the data dat.l <- basic %>%    # filter years and countries   filter(year %in% 1990:2010,          cname %in% c("Russia","China","India","Brazil")) %>%    # select variables   select(cname,year,p_polity2,wdi_pop1564) %>%    # gather to long format   gather(., var, value, 3:4) %>%    # remove NA values   filter(!is.na(value))  # Plot ggplot(dat.l, aes(x=year,y=value,color=cname)) +    geom_point() + geom_line() +   geom_text(data = dat.l %>%                group_by(cname) %>%                filter(year == max(year)),           aes(x=year,y=value,label=cname),           hjust=1,vjust=-1,size=3,alpha=.8) +   facet_wrap(~var, scales="free") +   theme_minimal() +     theme(legend.position = "none") +   labs(title = "Plotting QoG basic data",        caption = "Data: QoG Basic data") library(rqog) # Download a local coppy of the file standard <- read_qog("standard", "time-series") # Subset the data dat.l <- standard %>%    # filter years and countries   filter(year %in% 1990:2020,          cname %in% c("Russia","China","India","Brazil")) %>%    # select variables   select(cname,year,bti_ep,wdi_gini) %>%    # gather to long format   gather(., var, value, 3:4) %>%    # remove NA values   filter(!is.na(value))  # Plot the data # Plot ggplot(dat.l, aes(x=year,y=value,color=cname)) +    geom_point() + geom_line() +   geom_text(data = dat.l %>%                group_by(cname) %>%                filter(year == max(year)),           aes(x=year,y=value,label=cname),           hjust=1,vjust=-1,size=3,alpha=.8) +   facet_wrap(~var, scales="free") +   theme_minimal() +     theme(legend.position = "none") +   labs(title = "Plotting QoG Standard data",        caption = "Data: QoG Standard data") library(rqog) # Download a local coppy of the file oecd <- read_qog("oecd", "time-series") # Subset the data dat.l <- oecd %>%    # select variables   select(cname,year,oecd_pphlthxp_t1c,wdi_gini,oecd_natinccap_t1,oecd_govdebt_t1) %>%    # gather to long format   gather(., var, value, 3:6) %>%    # remove NA values   filter(!is.na(value))  # Plot the data # Plot ggplot(dat.l, aes(x=year,y=value,color=cname)) +    geom_point() + geom_line() +   geom_text(data = dat.l %>%                group_by(var,cname) %>%                filter(year == max(year)),           aes(x=year,y=value,label=cname),           hjust=1,vjust=-1,size=3,alpha=.8) +   facet_wrap(~var, scales="free") +   theme_minimal() +     theme(legend.position = "none") +   labs(title = "Plotting QoG OECD data",        caption = "Data: QoG OECD data")

what: Work with metadata and factor indicators
title: rqog-package for R
text: Packages shipped seven metadatas year (2016-2022) meta_basic_cs_2022, meta_basic_ts_2022, meta_std_cs_2022, meta_std_ts_2022, meta_oecd_cs_2022 meta_oecd_ts_2022. Data frames generated original spss versions data using tidymetadata::create_metadata()-function. Browsing metadata can browse content applying grepl name column. Let’s find indicators containing term Corruption either lower uppercase. Assigning labels values metadata data rqoq imports R .csv-format without labels names shipped together spss Stata formats. desired format work R, especially numeric indicators. However, many indicators QoG factors meaning discrete values corresponding label. can use metadatas assign labels values indicators. Lets take ccp_cc example first print value label colums data. Currently basic data R object called basic. Lets see frequencies value Now, using metadata assign values corresponding labels , lets find two factor variables values cross-sectional data Lets take two factors summarise regime types per regions can create simple bar plot
code: library(rqog) meta_basic_ts_2022[grepl("Corruption", meta_basic_ts_2022$name, ignore.case = TRUE),] ## # A tibble: 10 × 5 ##    code       name                                             value label class ##    <chr>      <chr>                                            <dbl> <chr> <chr> ##  1 bci_bci    The Bayesian Corruption Indicator                   NA NA    nume… ##  2 ccp_cc     Corruption Commission Present in Constitution        1 1. Y… fact… ##  3 ccp_cc     Corruption Commission Present in Constitution        2 2. No fact… ##  4 ccp_cc     Corruption Commission Present in Constitution       90 90. … fact… ##  5 ccp_cc     Corruption Commission Present in Constitution       96 96. … fact… ##  6 ccp_cc     Corruption Commission Present in Constitution       97 97. … fact… ##  7 ti_cpi     Corruption Perceptions Index                        NA NA    nume… ##  8 vdem_corr  Political corruption index                          NA NA    nume… ##  9 wbgi_cce   Control of Corruption, Estimate                     NA NA    nume… ## 10 wdi_tacpsr CPIA transparency-accountability-corruption in …    NA NA    nume… meta_basic_ts_2022 %>% filter(code == "ccp_cc") %>% select(value,label) ## # A tibble: 5 × 2 ##   value label                                   ##   <dbl> <chr>                                   ## 1     1 1. Yes                                  ## 2     2 2. No                                   ## 3    90 90. left explicitly to non-constitution ## 4    96 96. Other                               ## 5    97 97. Unable to determine basic %>% count(ccp_cc) ##   ccp_cc    n ## 1      1  527 ## 2      2 8999 ## 3     96  253 ## 4     NA 5389 basic %>%    count(ccp_cc) %>%    mutate(ccp_cc_lab = meta_basic_ts_2022[meta_basic_ts_2022$code == "ccp_cc",]$label[match(ccp_cc,meta_basic_ts_2022[meta_basic_ts_2022$code == "ccp_cc",]$value)]) ##   ccp_cc    n ccp_cc_lab ## 1      1  527     1. Yes ## 2      2 8999      2. No ## 3     96  253  96. Other ## 4     NA 5389       <NA> meta_basic_cs_2022 %>%    filter(class =="factor") %>%    group_by(code) %>%    summarise(n_of_values = n()) %>%    arrange(desc(n_of_values)) ## # A tibble: 20 × 2 ##    code         n_of_values ##    <chr>              <int> ##  1 gol_pr                28 ##  2 gol_est_spec          12 ##  3 ht_colonial           11 ##  4 ht_region             10 ##  5 cpds_tg                7 ##  6 ccp_slave              6 ##  7 ccp_cc                 5 ##  8 ccp_childwrk           5 ##  9 ccp_equal              5 ## 10 ccp_freerel            5 ## 11 gd_ptsa                5 ## 12 gd_ptsh                5 ## 13 lp_legor               5 ## 14 ccp_strike             4 ## 15 fhn_fotnst             3 ## 16 gol_est                3 ## 17 nelda_mbbe             3 ## 18 nelda_mtop             3 ## 19 nelda_oa               3 ## 20 nelda_rpae             3 meta_basic_cs_2022 %>%    filter(code %in% c("ht_region","ht_colonial")) %>%    distinct(code, .keep_all = TRUE) ## # A tibble: 2 × 5 ##   code        name                      value label                        class ##   <chr>       <chr>                     <dbl> <chr>                        <chr> ## 1 ht_colonial Colonial Origin               0 0. Never colonized by a Wes… fact… ## 2 ht_region   The Region of the Country     1 1. Eastern Europe and post … fact… # lets download the cross-sectional data first basic_cs <- read_qog(which_data = "basic", data_type = "cross-sectional")  plot_d <- basic_cs %>%    # group by region   group_by(ht_region) %>%    # count per group frequencies of each regime type   count(ht_colonial) %>%   ungroup() %>%    # label   mutate(ht_region_lab = meta_basic_ts_2022[meta_basic_ts_2022$code == "ht_region",]$label[match(ht_region,meta_basic_ts_2022[meta_basic_ts_2022$code == "ht_region",]$value)],          ht_colonial_lab = meta_basic_ts_2022[meta_basic_ts_2022$code == "ht_colonial",]$label[match(ht_colonial,meta_basic_ts_2022[meta_basic_ts_2022$code == "ht_colonial",]$value)]) %>%    na.omit() head(plot_d) ## # A tibble: 6 × 5 ##   ht_region ht_colonial     n ht_region_lab                      ht_colonial_lab ##       <int>       <int> <int> <chr>                              <chr>           ## 1         1           0    28 1. Eastern Europe and post Soviet… 0. Never colon… ## 2         2           2    18 2. Latin America                   2. Spanish      ## 3         2           6     1 2. Latin America                   6. French       ## 4         2           7     1 2. Latin America                   7. Portuguese   ## 5         3           0     4 3. North Africa & the Middle East  0. Never colon… ## 6         3           3     1 3. North Africa & the Middle East  3. Italian # lets abbreviate option '0. Never colonized by a Western overseas colonial power' to '0. Never' plot_d$ht_colonial_lab[plot_d$ht_colonial_lab == "0. Never colonized by a Western overseas colonial power"] <- '0. Never' # indicators names from metadata ind_name <- unique(meta_basic_cs_2022[meta_basic_cs_2022$code == "ht_colonial",]$name) group_name <- unique(meta_basic_cs_2022[meta_basic_cs_2022$code == "ht_region",]$name)  ggplot(plot_d, aes(x=ht_colonial_lab,y=n)) +    geom_col() +    facet_wrap(~ht_region_lab, scales = "free") +    theme_minimal() + theme(axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 90, size = 7)) +   labs(title = paste0(ind_name," by ",group_name ),         caption = "Data: Quality of Government institute", x = NULL, y = "number of countries") +   coord_flip() sessionInfo() ## R version 4.1.2 (2021-11-01) ## Platform: x86_64-pc-linux-gnu (64-bit) ## Running under: Linux Mint 20.3 ##  ## Matrix products: default ## BLAS:   /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/blas/libblas.so.3.9.0 ## LAPACK: /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/lapack/liblapack.so.3.9.0 ##  ## locale: ##  [1] LC_CTYPE=fi_FI.UTF-8       LC_NUMERIC=C               ##  [3] LC_TIME=fi_FI.UTF-8        LC_COLLATE=fi_FI.UTF-8     ##  [5] LC_MONETARY=fi_FI.UTF-8    LC_MESSAGES=fi_FI.UTF-8    ##  [7] LC_PAPER=fi_FI.UTF-8       LC_NAME=C                  ##  [9] LC_ADDRESS=C               LC_TELEPHONE=C             ## [11] LC_MEASUREMENT=fi_FI.UTF-8 LC_IDENTIFICATION=C        ##  ## attached base packages: ## [1] stats     graphics  grDevices utils     datasets  methods   base      ##  ## other attached packages: ## [1] tidyr_1.1.4   ggplot2_3.3.5 dplyr_1.0.7   rqog_0.4.2022 ##  ## loaded via a namespace (and not attached): ##  [1] tidyselect_1.1.1  xfun_0.29         bslib_0.3.1       purrr_0.3.4       ##  [5] haven_2.4.3       colorspace_2.0-2  vctrs_0.3.8       generics_0.1.1    ##  [9] htmltools_0.5.2   yaml_2.2.2        utf8_1.2.2        rlang_1.0.0       ## [13] pkgdown_2.0.2     jquerylib_0.1.4   pillar_1.6.5      glue_1.6.1        ## [17] withr_2.4.3       DBI_1.1.2         readxl_1.3.1      lifecycle_1.0.1   ## [21] stringr_1.4.0     munsell_0.5.0     gtable_0.3.0      cellranger_1.1.0  ## [25] ragg_1.2.1        memoise_2.0.1     evaluate_0.14     labeling_0.4.2    ## [29] knitr_1.37        forcats_0.5.1     fastmap_1.1.0     fansi_1.0.2       ## [33] highr_0.9         Rcpp_1.0.8        scales_1.1.1      cachem_1.0.6      ## [37] desc_1.4.0        jsonlite_1.7.3    farver_2.1.0      systemfonts_1.0.3 ## [41] fs_1.5.2          textshaping_0.3.6 hms_1.1.1         digest_0.6.29     ## [45] stringi_1.7.6     rprojroot_2.0.2   grid_4.1.2        cli_3.1.1         ## [49] tools_4.1.2       magrittr_2.0.2    sass_0.4.0        tibble_3.1.6      ## [53] crayon_1.4.2      pkgconfig_2.0.3   ellipsis_0.3.2    assertthat_0.2.1  ## [57] rmarkdown_2.11    rstudioapi_0.13   R6_2.5.1          compiler_4.1.2

title: Authors and Citation
text: Markus Kainu. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Kainu M (2022). rqog: Download data Quality Government Institute data. https://ropengov.github.io/rqog/, https://github.com/rOpenGov/rqog.
code: @Manual{,   title = {rqog: Download data from the Quality of Government Institute data},   author = {Markus Kainu},   year = {2022},   note = {https://ropengov.github.io/rqog/, https://github.com/rOpenGov/rqog}, }

what: Download data from the Quality of Government Institute data
title: Download data from the Quality of Government Institute data
text: Download latest archived datasets Quality Government Institute using function read_qog(). See ?read_qog help, package vignette examples data.markuskainu.fi/qog/ interactive metadata.

title: Download data from the Quality of Government Institute data
text: Alternatively, can use r-universe:
code: remotes::install_github("ropengov/rqog") # Enable this universe options(repos = c(   ropengov = "https://ropengov.r-universe.dev",   CRAN = "https://cloud.r-project.org" ))  install.packages("rqog")

title: Download data from the Quality of Government Institute data
text: Download data Browse metadata Plot indicator  Copyright (C) 2012-2022 Markus Kainu markuskainu@gmail.com. MIT-licence.
code: library(rqog) dat <- read_qog(which_data = "standard", data_type = "time-series") library(rqog) meta_std_ts_2022[grepl("human development", meta_std_ts_2022$name, ignore.case = TRUE),] #> # A tibble: 2 × 5 #>   code     name                    value label class   #>   <chr>    <chr>                   <dbl> <chr> <chr>   #> 1 iiag_hd  Human Development          NA <NA>  numeric #> 2 undp_hdi Human Development Index    NA <NA>  numeric library(ggplot2) ggplot(dat[!is.na(dat$undp_hdi),],         aes(x = year, y = undp_hdi, color = cname)) +    geom_line() +    theme(legend.position = "none")

title: Download data from the Quality of Government Institute data
text: package way officially related endorsed Quality Government Institute.

what: Metadata for 2016 Quality of Government institute Basic Data - cross-sectional — meta_basic_cs_2016
title: Metadata for 2016 Quality of Government institute Basic Data - cross-sectional — meta_basic_cs_2016
text: Generated automatically spss-version Quality Government Basic data using tidymetadata::create_metadata() function.  Formatted tidy-format row per value indicator. Numeric indicators single row per indicator.

what: Retrieve and Read Quality of Government Institute data in R — read_qog
title: Retrieve and Read Quality of Government Institute data in R — read_qog
text: Download data Quality Government Institute Basic data http://www.qog.pol.gu.se/data/

title: Retrieve and Read Quality of Government Institute data in R — read_qog
code: read_qog(   which_data = "basic",   data_type = "time-series",   year = 2022,   data_dir = NULL,   file_format = "csv",   download_only = FALSE,   cache = TRUE,   update_cache = FALSE )

title: Retrieve and Read Quality of Government Institute data in R — read_qog
text: which_data string. Specify name QoG data set retrieve. Currently available "basic", "standard", "oecd" "social_policy". data_type string. Specify whether want cross-sectional time-series QoG data set retrieve. Currently available "cross-sectional" "time-series". year numeric. Specify year dataset. Year refers publication year dataset year particular data point. Default 2019 data_dir path cache directory. directory exist. NULL (default) uses creates 'rqog' directory temporary directory tempdir. file_format string. Specify file format want download import. Currently available "csv","dta", "sav" "xlsx". download_only logical whether download save dataset skip importing R.  Default FALSE. cache logical whether caching. Default TRUE. update_cache locigal whether update cache. Default FALSE.

title: Retrieve and Read Quality of Government Institute data in R — read_qog
text: data.frame

title: Retrieve and Read Quality of Government Institute data in R — read_qog
text: Markus Kainu <markuskainu()gmail.com>

title: Retrieve and Read Quality of Government Institute data in R — read_qog
rqog 0.4.2022
text: content variables municipality keys related hyvinvointialue (Wellbeing Service Counties) changed matches now classification Statistics Finland New function get_municipality_pop() added getting population numbers spatial data Finnish municipalities years 2010-2020 Function get_zipcodes() new argument extend_to_sea_areas case need spatial data extend coastline
